```{r load-objects, echo=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(tibble)
```

Manual curation of a data set this size in a principled, consistent manner is not feasible. Therefore, we automated data cleaning using custom *R* scripts. Cleaning is divided into six sequential steps \autoref{tbl-parameters}.

```{r, parameters, echo=FALSE,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
#| label: tbl-parameters
#| tbl-cap: "caption"

df_parameters = read_csv("../data/parameters1.csv", col_types = "cccc", n_max = 6) 

df_parameters |>
  dplyr::select(Parameter = latex, Description = description) |>
  knitr::kable(
    format = "latex",
    align = c("c", "l"),
    booktabs = TRUE,
    escape = FALSE
  ) |>
  kableExtra::kable_styling(latex_options = c("striped", "no_vertical_lines")) |>
  kableExtra::column_spec(1, width = "1in") |>
  kableExtra::column_spec(2, width = "5in") |>
  kableExtra::pack_rows("\\agcurve{} curve parameters",
                        min(which(df_parameters$par_type == "ags")),
                        max(which(df_parameters$par_type == "ags")),
                        escape = FALSE) #|>
                        # kableExtra::pack_rows("x", 2, 2)


```
